primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement of the human person from a state of false security or dread before the judgment seat to a state of justified peace through the intercession of Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: God, who is rich in mercy... made us alive
Christ Jesus... indeed intercedes for us
news of our deliverance from every form of condemnation

zender.identificatie: God the Father (as Source of Truth and Judge)
tekstueel_bewijs: Almighty God, to whom all hearts are open
I am the defendant. You are the defendant.
help thy servants whom thou hast redeemed

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit (Advocate) and the Blood of Christ
tekstueel_bewijs: The Holy Spirit is the defense attorney
testifies to the Blood of Christ

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin / The 'Old Man' / The Faceless Judges (Condemnation)
tekstueel_bewijs: our sinful self... will be destroyed
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but the ontological reality of sin and the 'Old Man' facing divine holiness.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Christian community presenting itself for judgment to become tools for God's work.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/service) is explicitly grounded in the primary program (justification).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God made us alive together with Christ
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we don’t have as much shared history
we take upon ourselves a work

voorbeelden: We must all appear before the judgment seat
the reason I wanted to work here
The Church knows something the world does not know
God will give the power of final judgment

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's power to justify and the Spirit's power to advocate, rather than human obligation.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S1 (early intoxication) to S2 (the reality of judgment), then rejects ~S2 (denial of judgment) to find the resolution where S1 encloses S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The judgment (S2) is not bypassed but 'enclosed in mercy' (S1) through the work of Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; judgment is described as a 'refiner's fire' and 'divine Surgeon'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon maintains God as the primary actor and places the human hearer in the position of the 'wretched defendant' who receives an external righteousness.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential for 'taking upon ourselves a work'
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Now is the time to take upon ourselves a work in which we are the first to be given into judgment

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It is God who justifies; who is to condemn?
Our sinful self... will be destroyed

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures like Paul or the Prophets are used as witnesses to truth, not as moral models to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric focus remains on God's action through Christ.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and 'holy fear' leading to gratitude.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The tension between 'no condemnation' and 'judgment seat' is resolved narratively through the image of the Advocate.
spanning_punten: The transition from the 'rapture' of early grace to the 'daily business' of being God's people.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ Jesus, who died... who indeed intercedes for us

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (legal standing) that the human lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; requires destruction of the 'old man'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a robustly theocentric narrative where God is the Subject of both judgment and mercy.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on Devoir in the middle section.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on Pouvoir (God's ability).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'work' the church takes on is clearly defined as a response to the Spirit.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as the 'Old Man' and 'Sinful Self'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of maintaining the 'Grammar of Grace' while taking the 'Law' (Judgment) seriously.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the Daumier painting as an illustration, Greimassian analysis reveals the painting functions as the 'Actantial shift' where the Advocate replaces the Subject's incompetence.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 14; semiotics shows how the sermon makes the hearer 'inhabit' the role of the defendant.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'wrath' of the congregation in 1981 was a narrative refusal to accept the 'Opponent' actant, which the preacher successfully reintroduces without losing the 'Object' of Grace.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by focusing on the 'Divine Surgeon' rather than 'Human Self-Improvement'.
